result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayshawn L.A. Perkins

records.addlTxt:
Attorneys Jeff Allen Schwarz and Tom Reed in court, defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed no later than 48 hours prior to final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed no later than 11/1/2022.  Court orders defense counsel to e-file pretrial order with defendant's signature no later than 2 weeks.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Parties requests a new status date. Case is rescheduled. Parties notified of the new court date  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court is advised of intent to enter NGI plea.  Case adjourned to branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz. Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in custody.  
Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Defense in receipt of discovery and no offer at this time. Defense is seeking additional time to obtain additional mental health records. State has no objection to Defense request for adjournment. Case remains calendared before Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz & Attorney Thomas Reed; they appear by video.  Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Sgt. C. Thimm. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in custody.  
Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Doctor's Report. Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law. Doctor's Report received and filed.  Doctor's report read by parties.  Parties do not dispute the findings. Court found defendant competent to proceed. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Competency Report

Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Rayshawn L.A. Perkins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rayshawn L.A. Perkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
